arabicText: الٓمٓ
englishTranslationText:
Alif-Lam-Meem*.	(*Alphabets of the 
Arabic language; Allah and to whomever 
He reveals, know their precise 
meanings.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Alif-Lam-Meem*.	(*Arabi zabān ke 
Huroof jinke Ma’āni Allah aur Jis par 
Allah Ta’āla ne Inko Nazil Farmaya Wahi 
Janta hai.)

arabicText: تَنزِيلُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لَا رَيْبَ فِيهِ مِن رَّبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
The	revelation	of	the	Book	is,	without	
doubt,	from	the	Lord	Of	The	Creation.
romanUrduTranslationText:
The	Kitāb	kā	utārnā	be-shak	Parwardigār
e-'āalam	ki	ṭaraf	se	hai.

arabicText: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ ٱفْتَرَىٰهُ ۚ بَلْ هُوَ ٱلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكَ لِتُنذِرَ قَوْمًۭا مَّآ أَتَىٰهُم مِّن نَّذِيرٍۢ مِّن قَبْلِكَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَهْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
What!	They	dare	say	that,	“He	has	
fabricated	it”?	In	fact	it	is	the	Truth	from	
your	Lord,	in	order	that	you	warn	a	nation	
towards	whom	no	Herald	of	Warning	
came	before	you,	in	the	hope	of	their	
attaining	guidance.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	kahte	haiñ	un	ki	banāyi	huyi	hai	balke	
wohi	ḥaq	hai	tumhāre	Rab	ki	ṭaraf	se	ke	
tum	darāo	aise	logoñ	ko	jin	ke	pās	tum	se	
pahle	koi	dar	sunāne	wālā	na	āayā	is	
ummid	par	ke	woh	rāh	pāyeñ.

arabicText: ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِى سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍۢ ثُمَّ ٱسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْعَرْشِ ۖ مَا لَكُم مِّن دُونِهِۦ مِن وَلِىٍّۢ وَلَا شَفِيعٍ ۚ أَفَلَا تَتَذَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	Allah	Who	created	the	heavens	and	
the	earth,	and	all	that	is	between	them,	in	
six	days	-	then	(befitting	His	Majesty)	
established	Himself	upon	the	Throne	(of	
control);	leaving	Allah,	there	is	neither	a	
friend	nor	an	intercessor	for	you;	so	do	
you	not	ponder?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	hai	jis	ne	āasmān	aur	zameen	aur	jo	
kuch	in	ke	beech	meiñ	hai	chhe	din	meiñ	
banāye	phir	‘arsh	par	istiwā	farmāyā	us	se	
chhot	kar	(lā	ta'alluq	ho	kar)	tumhārā	
koyi	ḥimāyati	na	sifārashi	to	kyā	tum	
dhiyān	nahiñ	karte.

arabicText: يُدَبِّرُ ٱلْأَمْرَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ إِلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ ثُمَّ يَعْرُجُ إِلَيْهِ فِى يَوْمٍۢ كَانَ مِقْدَارُهُۥٓ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍۢ مِّمَّا تَعُدُّونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	plans	the	affair	from	the	heaven	to	the	
earth	-	then	it	will	return	to	Him	on	the	
Day	which	amounts	to	a	thousand	years	
in	your	count.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kām	ki	tadbir	farmātā	hai	āasmān	se	
zameen	tak	phir	usi	ki	ṭaraf	ruju'	kare	ga	
us	din	ke	jis	ki	miqdār	hazār	baras	hai	
tumhāri	ginti	meiñ.

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ عَـٰلِمُ ٱلْغَيْبِ وَٱلشَّهَـٰدَةِ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
This	is	the	All	Knowing	-	of	all	the	hidden	
and	the	visible,	the	Most	Honourable,	the	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ye	hai	har	nihāñ	aur	'ayāñ	kā	jānne	wālā	
ízzat	o	raḥmat	wālā.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِىٓ أَحْسَنَ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ خَلَقَهُۥ ۖ وَبَدَأَ خَلْقَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنِ مِن طِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText: The	One	Who	created	all	things	excellent,	and	Who	initiated	the	creation	of	man	from	clay
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	jis	ne	jo	cheez	banāyi	khoob	banāyi	aur	paidāish-e-insān	ki	ibtidā	mitti	se	farmāyi.

arabicText: ثُمَّ جَعَلَ نَسْلَهُۥ مِن سُلَـٰلَةٍۢ مِّن مَّآءٍۢ مَّهِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText: Then	kept	his	posterity	with	a	part	of	an	abject	fluid.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	us	ki	nasl	rakhi	aik	be-qadr	pāni	ke	khulāse	se.	.

arabicText: ثُمَّ سَوَّىٰهُ وَنَفَخَ فِيهِ مِن رُّوحِهِۦ ۖ وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَٱلْأَبْصَـٰرَ وَٱلْأَفْـِٔدَةَ ۚ قَلِيلًۭا مَّا تَشْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Then	made	him	proper	and	blew	into	him	a	spirit	from	Him,	and	bestowed	ears	and	eyes	and	
hearts	to	you;	very	little	thanks	do	you	offer!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	usey	theek	kiyā	aur	us	meiñ	apni	ṭaraf	ki	roḥ	phoñki	aur	tumheñ	kān	aur	āankheñ	aur	dil	
'aṭā	farmāye	kyā	hi	thodā	ḥaq	mānte	ho.

arabicText: وَقَالُوٓا۟ أَءِذَا ضَلَلْنَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ أَءِنَّا لَفِى خَلْقٍۢ جَدِيدٍۭ ۚ بَلْ هُم بِلِقَآءِ رَبِّهِمْ كَـٰفِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	said,	“When	we	have	mingled	into	the	earth,	will	we	be	created	again?”;	in	fact	they	
disbelieve	in	the	meeting	with	their	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	bole	kyā	jab	ham	mitti	meiñ	mil	jāyeñ	ge	kyā	phir	naye	baneñ	ge	balke	woh	apne	rab	ke	
ḥuzoor	ḥāziri	se	munkir	haiñ.

arabicText: ۞ قُلْ يَتَوَفَّىٰكُم مَّلَكُ ٱلْمَوْتِ ٱلَّذِى وُكِّلَ بِكُمْ ثُمَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكُمْ تُرْجَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“The	angel	of	death,	who	is	appointed	over	you,	causes	you	to	die	and	then	towards	
your	Lord	you	will	return.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	tumheñ	wafāt	detā	hai	Maut	kā	Farishta	jo	tum	par	muqarrar	hai	phir	apne	Rab	ki	
ṭaraf	wāpas	jāo	ge.

arabicText: وَلَوْ تَرَىٰٓ إِذِ ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ نَاكِسُوا۟ رُءُوسِهِمْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ رَبَّنَآ أَبْصَرْنَا وَسَمِعْنَا فَٱرْجِعْنَا نَعْمَلْ صَـٰلِحًا إِنَّا مُوقِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	you	see	when	the	guilty	will	hang	
their	heads	before	their	Lord;	“Our	Lord!	
We	have	seen	and	heard,	therefore	send	
us	back	in	order	that	we	do	good	deeds	-	
we	are	now	convinced!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kahiñ	tum	dekho	jab	mujrim	apne	
Rab	ke	pās	sar	neeche	dale	hoñ	ge	aey	
hamāre	Rab	ab	ham	ne	dekhā	aur	sunā	
hameñ	phir	bhej	ke	nek	kām	kareñ	ham	
ko	yaqeen	āa	gayā.

arabicText: وَلَوْ شِئْنَا لَـَٔاتَيْنَا كُلَّ نَفْسٍ هُدَىٰهَا وَلَـٰكِنْ حَقَّ ٱلْقَوْلُ مِنِّى لَأَمْلَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنَ ٱلْجِنَّةِ وَٱلنَّاسِ أَجْمَعِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	had	We	willed	We	would	have	given	
every	soul	its	guidance,	but	My	Word	is	
decreed	that	I	will	certainly	fill	hell	with	
these	jinns	and	men,	combined.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	ham	chāhte	har	jān	ko	us	ki	
hidāyat	'aṭā	farmāte	magar	meri	bāt	qarār	
pā	chuki	ke	zaror	Jahannam	ko	bhar	duñ	
gā	un	jinnoñ	aur	āadmiyoñ	sab	se.

arabicText: فَذُوقُوا۟ بِمَا نَسِيتُمْ لِقَآءَ يَوْمِكُمْ هَـٰذَآ إِنَّا نَسِينَـٰكُمْ ۖ وَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابَ ٱلْخُلْدِ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Therefore	taste	the	recompense	of	your	
forgetting	the	confronting	of	this	day	of	
yours;	We	have	abandoned	you	–	now	
taste	the	everlasting	punishment,	the	
recompense	of	your	deeds!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ab	chakho	badla	us	kā	ke	tum	apne	is	din	
ki	ḥaziri	bhoole	the	ham	ne	tumheñ	chod	
diyā	ab	hamesha	kā	'aƶāb	chakho	apne	
kiye	kā	badla.

arabicText: إِنَّمَا يُؤْمِنُ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ذُكِّرُوا۟ بِهَا خَرُّوا۟ سُجَّدًۭا وَسَبَّحُوا۟ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّهِمْ وَهُمْ لَا يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ ۩
englishTranslationText:
Only	those	believe	in	Our	signs	who,	when	
they	are	reminded	of	them,	fall	down	in	
prostration	and	proclaim	the	Purity	of	
their	Lord	while	praising	Him,	and	are	not	
conceited.	(Command	of	Prostration	#	
9).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hamāri	āayatoñ	par	wohi	Imān	lāte	haiñ	
ke	jab	woh	unheñ	yād	dilāyi	jāti	hai	Sajde	
meiñ	gir	jāte	haiñ	aur	apne	Rab	ki	ta'arif	
karte	huye	us	ki	pāki	bolte	haiñ	aur	
takabbur	nahiñ	karte.	(Sajda	karne	ka	
hukm	#9)

arabicText: تَتَجَافَىٰ جُنُوبُهُمْ عَنِ ٱلْمَضَاجِعِ يَدْعُونَ رَبَّهُمْ خَوْفًۭا وَطَمَعًۭا وَمِمَّا رَزَقْنَـٰهُمْ يُنفِقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Their	sides	stay	detached	from	their	beds	
and	they	pray	to	their	Lord	with	fear	and	
hope	-	and	they	spend	from	what	We	have	
bestowed	upon	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	ki	karwateñ	judā	hoti	haiñ	khuwāb	
gāhoñ	se	aur	apne	Rab	ko	pukārte	haiñ	
darte	aur	ummid	karte	aur	hamāre	diye	
huye	meiñ	se	kuch	khairāt	karte	haiñ.

arabicText: فَلَا تَعْلَمُ نَفْسٌۭ مَّآ أُخْفِىَ لَهُم مِّن قُرَّةِ أَعْيُنٍۢ جَزَآءًۢ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	no	soul	knows	the	comfort	of	the	eyes	
that	is	kept	hidden	for	them	*;	the	reward	of	their	deeds.	(Paradise)
romanUrduTranslationText: To	kisi	ji	ko	nahiñ	ma'alom	jo	āañkh	ki	thandak	un	ke	liye	chipā	rakhi	hai	sila	un	ke	kāmoñ	kā.

arabicText: أَفَمَن كَانَ مُؤْمِنًۭا كَمَن كَانَ فَاسِقًۭا ۚ لَّا يَسْتَوُۥنَ
englishTranslationText: So	will	the	believer	ever	be	equal	to	the	one	who	is	lawless?	They	are	not	equal!
romanUrduTranslationText: To	kyā	jo	Imān	wālā	hai	wo	us	jaisā	ho	jāye	gā	jo	be-ḥukm	hai	ye	barābar	nahiñ.

arabicText: أَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ فَلَهُمْ جَنَّـٰتُ ٱلْمَأْوَىٰ نُزُلًۢا بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	accepted	faith	and	did	good	deeds	–	for	them	are	the	Gardens	of	(everlasting)	stay;	a	
welcome	in	return	for	what	they	did.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jo	Imān	lāye	aur	achche	kām	kiye	un	ke	liye	basne	ke	bāgh	haiñ	un	ke	kāmoñ	ke	sile	meiñ	
mahmān	dāri.

arabicText: وَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ فَسَقُوا۟ فَمَأْوَىٰهُمُ ٱلنَّارُ ۖ كُلَّمَآ أَرَادُوٓا۟ أَن يَخْرُجُوا۟ مِنْهَآ أُعِيدُوا۟ فِيهَا وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ ذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابَ ٱلنَّارِ ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who	are	lawless	-	their	destination	is	the	fire;	whenever	they	wish	to	come	out	of	it,	
they	will	be	returned	into	it,	and	it	will	be	said	to	them,	“Taste	the	punishment	of	the	fire	you	
used	to	deny!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Rahe	woh	jo	be-ḥukm	haiñ	un	kā	thikānā	āag	hai	jab	kabhi	us	meiñ	se	niklnā	chāheñ	ge	phir	usi	
meiñ	pher	diye	jāyeñ	ge	aur	un	se	farmāyā	jāye	gā	chakho	is	āag	kā	'aƶāb	jise	tum	jhutlāte	the.

arabicText: وَلَنُذِيقَنَّهُم مِّنَ ٱلْعَذَابِ ٱلْأَدْنَىٰ دُونَ ٱلْعَذَابِ ٱلْأَكْبَرِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَرْجِعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	shall	indeed	make	them	taste	the	
smaller	punishment	before	the	greater	
punishment,	so	that	they	may	return.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	zaroor	Ham	unheñ	chakhāyeñ	ge	
kuch	nazdik	kā	ázāb	us	Bade	Din	se	pahle	
jise	dekhne	wālā	ummid	kare	ke	abhi	bāz	
āayeñ	ge.

arabicText: وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّن ذُكِّرَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِۦ ثُمَّ أَعْرَضَ عَنْهَآ ۚ إِنَّا مِنَ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ مُنتَقِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	who	is	more	unjust	than	one	who	is	
preached	to	from	the	verses	his	Lord,	then	
he	turns	away	from	them?	We	will	indeed	
take	revenge	from	the	guilty.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	se	badh	kar	zālim	kaun	jise	us	ke	
rab	ki	āayatoñ	se	nasiḥat	ki	gayi	phir	us	
ne	un	se	moñh	pher	liyā	be-shak	ham	
mujrimoñ	se	badla	lene	wāle	haiñ.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا مُوسَى ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ فَلَا تَكُن فِى مِرْيَةٍۢ مِّن لِّقَآئِهِۦ ۖ وَجَعَلْنَـٰهُ هُدًۭى لِّبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	bestowed	the	Book	to	
Moosa,	therefore	have	no	doubt	in	its	
acquisition,	and	made	it	a	guidance	for	the	
Descendants	of	Israel.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	Mūsā	ko	Kitāb	'aṭā	
farmāyi	to	tum	us	ke	milne	meiñ	shak	na	
karo	aur	ham	ne	usey	bani	isrāyil	ke	liye	
hidāyat	kiyā.

arabicText: وَجَعَلْنَا مِنْهُمْ أَئِمَّةًۭ يَهْدُونَ بِأَمْرِنَا لَمَّا صَبَرُوا۟ ۖ وَكَانُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا يُوقِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	made	some	leaders	among	them,	
guiding	by	Our	command,	when	they	had	
persevered;	and	they	used	to	accept	faith	
in	Our	signs.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	ne	un	meiñ	se	kuch	Imam	
banāye	ke	hamāre	ḥukm	se	batāte	jab	ke	
unhoñ	ne	sabr	kyā	aur	woh	hamāri	
Āayatoñ	par	yaqeen	lāte	the.

arabicText: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ يَفْصِلُ بَيْنَهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ فِيمَا كَانُوا۟ فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	your	Lord	will	judge	between	
them	on	the	Day	of	Resurrection	
concerning	the	matters	in	which	they	
used	to	differ.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	tumhārā	Rab	un	meiñ	faisla	kar	
degā	Qayāmat	ke	din	jis	bāt	meiñ	ikhtilāf	
karte	the.

arabicText: أَوَلَمْ يَهْدِ لَهُمْ كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَبْلِهِم مِّنَ ٱلْقُرُونِ يَمْشُونَ فِى مَسَـٰكِنِهِمْ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍ ۖ أَفَلَا يَسْمَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	did	they	not	obtain	guidance	by	the	
fact	that	We	did	destroy	many	
generations	before	them,	so	now	they	
walk	in	their	houses?	Indeed	in	this	are	
signs;	so	do	they	not	heed?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kyā	unheñ	is	par	hidāyat	na	huyi	ke	
Ham	ne	un	se	pahle	kitni	sangateñ	halāk	kar	diñ	ke	āaj	ye	un	ke	gharoñ	meiñ	chal	phir	rahe	haiñ	
be-shak	is	meiñ	zaror	nishāniyāñ	haiñ	to	kyā	sunte	nahiñ.

arabicText: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ أَنَّا نَسُوقُ ٱلْمَآءَ إِلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ ٱلْجُرُزِ فَنُخْرِجُ بِهِۦ زَرْعًۭا تَأْكُلُ مِنْهُ أَنْعَـٰمُهُمْ وَأَنفُسُهُمْ ۖ أَفَلَا يُبْصِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	do	they	not	see	that	We	send	the	water	to	the	barren	land	and	produce	crops	with	it,	so	
their	animals	and	they	themselves	eat	from	it?	So	do	they	not	perceive?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kyā	nahiñ	dekhte	ke	ham	pāni	bhejte	haiñ	khushk	zameen	ki	ṭaraf	phir	us	se	kheti	nikālte	
haiñ	ke	us	meiñ	se	un	ke	chaupāye	aur	woh	khud	khāte	haiñ	to	kyā	unheñ	sojhtā	nahiñ.

arabicText: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَـٰذَا ٱلْفَتْحُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	they	say,	“When	will	this	decision	take	place,	if	you	are	truthful?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	kahte	haiñ	ye	faisla	kab	hogā	agar	tum	sachche	ho.

arabicText: قُلْ يَوْمَ ٱلْفَتْحِ لَا يَنفَعُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ إِيمَـٰنُهُمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُنظَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“On	the	Day	of	Decision	*,	the	disbelievers	will	not	benefit	from	their	accepting	faith,	
nor	will	they	get	respite.”	(*	Of	death	or	of	resurrection)
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	farmāo	faisle	ke	din	kāfiroñ	ko	un	kā	Imān	lānā	nafa'a	na	degā	aur	na	unheñ	muhlat	mile.

arabicText: فَأَعْرِضْ عَنْهُمْ وَٱنتَظِرْ إِنَّهُم مُّنتَظِرُونَ
englishTranslationText: Therefore	turn	away	from	them	and	wait	–	indeed	they	too	have	to	wait.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	un	se	monh	pher	lo	aur	intizar	karo	be-shak	unheñ	bhi	intizar	karnā	hai.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ ٱتَّقِ ٱللَّهَ وَلَا تُطِعِ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ وَٱلْمُنَـٰفِقِينَ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
O	Herald	of	the	Hidden	(the	Prophet),	
continue	to	fear	Allah	and	never	listen	to	
the	disbelievers	and	the	hypocrites;	
indeed	Allah	is	All	Knowing,	Wise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Ghaib	ki	khabreñ	batāne	wāle	(Nabi)	
Allāh	kā	yuñ	hi	khauf	rakhnā	aur	kāfiroñ	
aur	munāfiqoñ	ki	na	sunnā	be-shak	Allāh	
'Ilm-o-Hikmat	wālā	hai.

arabicText: وَٱتَّبِعْ مَا يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَيْكَ مِن رَّبِّكَ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	keep	following	what	is	sent	down	to	
you	from	your	Lord;	O	people!	Indeed	
Allah	is	seeing	your	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Ghaib	ki	khabreñ	batāne	wāle	(Nabi)	
Allāh	kā	yuñ	hi	khauf	rakhnā	aur	kāfiroñ	
aur	munāfiqoñ	ki	na	sunnā	be-shak	Allāh	
'Ilm-o-Hikmat	wālā	hai.

arabicText: وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِٱللَّهِ وَكِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	trust	Allah;	and	Allah	is	Sufficient	as	a	
Trustee.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	aey	Meḥboob	tum	Allāh	par	bharosa	
rakho	aur	Allāh	bas (kāfi)	hai	kām	banane	
wālā.

arabicText: مَّا جَعَلَ ٱللَّهُ لِرَجُلٍۢ مِّن قَلْبَيْنِ فِى جَوْفِهِۦ ۚ وَمَا جَعَلَ أَزْوَٰجَكُمُ ٱلَّـٰٓـِٔى تُظَـٰهِرُونَ مِنْهُنَّ أُمَّهَـٰتِكُمْ ۚ وَمَا جَعَلَ أَدْعِيَآءَكُمْ أَبْنَآءَكُمْ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ قَوْلُكُم بِأَفْوَٰهِكُمْ ۖ وَٱللَّهُ يَقُولُ ٱلْحَقَّ وَهُوَ يَهْدِى ٱلسَّبِيلَ
englishTranslationText:
Allah	has	not	kept	two	hearts	in	the	body	
of	any	man;	nor	has	He	made	them	your	
mothers	those	wives	of	yours,	whom	you	
declare	to	be	your	mothers;	nor	has	He	
made	them	your	sons,	whom	you	have	
adopted;	this	is	the	statement	of	your	
mouths;	and	Allah	proclaims	the	truth	and	
it	is	He	Who	shows	the	path.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	ne	kisi	āadmi	ke	andar	do	dil	na	
rkhe	aur	tumhāri	un	'auratoñ	ko	jinheñ	
tum	māñ	ke	barābar	kah	do	tumhāri	māñ	
na	banāyā	aur	na	tumhāre	le pālkoñ	ko	
tumhāra	beta	banāyā	ye	tumhāre	apne	
moñh	kā	kahnā	hai	aur	Allāh	ḥaq	farmātā	
hai	aur	wohi	rāh	dikhātā	hai.

arabicText: ٱدْعُوهُمْ لِـَٔابَآئِهِمْ هُوَ أَقْسَطُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ فَإِن لَّمْ تَعْلَمُوٓا۟ ءَابَآءَهُمْ فَإِخْوَٰنُكُمْ فِى ٱلدِّينِ وَمَوَٰلِيكُمْ ۚ وَلَيْسَ عَلَيْكُمْ جُنَاحٌۭ فِيمَآ أَخْطَأْتُم بِهِۦ وَلَـٰكِن مَّا تَعَمَّدَتْ قُلُوبُكُمْ ۚ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ غَفُورًۭا رَّحِيمًا
englishTranslationText:
Call	them	with	their	fathers’	names	–	this	
is	more	suitable	in	the	sight	of	Allah;	and	
if	you	do	not	know	their	fathers,	then	they	
are	your	brothers	in	the	faith,	(and	your	
cousins	as	humans)	and	your	friends;	and	
there	is	no	sin	upon	you	for	what	you	did	unknowingly	in	the	past	–	however	it	is	a	sin	what	you	
do	with	your	heart’s	intention;	and	Allah	is	Oft	Forgiving,	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Unheñ	un	ke	bāp	hi	kā	kah	kar	pukāro	ye	Allāh	ke	nazdeek	ziyāda	thik	hai phir	agar	tumheñ	un	
ke	bāp	ma'alom	na	hoñ	to	deen	meiñ	tumhāre	bhāi	haiñ	aur	bashariyat	meiñ	tumhāre	chachā
zād	aur	tum	par	is	meiñ	kuch	gunāh	nahiñ	jo	nā-danista	tum	se	sādir	huā	hāñ	woh	gunāh	hai	jo	
dil	ke	qasd	se	karo	aur	Allāh	bakhshne	wālā	maharbān	hai.

arabicText: ٱلنَّبِىُّ أَوْلَىٰ بِٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ مِنْ أَنفُسِهِمْ ۖ وَأَزْوَٰجُهُۥٓ أُمَّهَـٰتُهُمْ ۗ وَأُو۟لُوا۟ ٱلْأَرْحَامِ بَعْضُهُمْ أَوْلَىٰ بِبَعْضٍۢ فِى كِتَـٰبِ ٱللَّهِ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُهَـٰجِرِينَ إِلَّآ أَن تَفْعَلُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰٓ أَوْلِيَآئِكُم مَّعْرُوفًۭا ۚ كَانَ ذَٰلِكَ فِى ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ مَسْطُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
The	Prophet	is	closer	to	the	Muslims	than	their	own	lives,	and	his	wives	are	their	mothers;	and	
the	relatives	are	closer	to	each	other	in	the	Book	of	Allah,	than	other	Muslims	and	immigrants,	
except	that	you	may	be	kind	towards	your	friends;	this	is	written	in	the	Book.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ye	Nabi	Musalmānoñ	kā	un	ki	jā’n	se	ziyāda	mālik	hai	aur	Us	ki	biwiyāñ	un	ki	māye’ñ	haiñ	aur	
rishtey	wāle	Allāh	ki	Kitāb	meiñ	aik	doosre	se	ziyāda	qareeb	haiñ	ba-nisbat	aur	Musalmānoñ	
aur	muhājiroñ	ke	magar	ye	ki	tum	apne	dostoñ	par	koi	eḥsān	karo	ye	kitāb	meiñ	likhā	hai.

arabicText: وَإِذْ أَخَذْنَا مِنَ ٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ مِيثَـٰقَهُمْ وَمِنكَ وَمِن نُّوحٍۢ وَإِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَمُوسَىٰ وَعِيسَى ٱبْنِ مَرْيَمَ ۖ وَأَخَذْنَا مِنْهُم مِّيثَـٰقًا غَلِيظًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	remember	O	dear	Prophet	
(Muhammad	–	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him)	when	We	took	a	covenant	from	the	
Prophets	-	and	from	you	-	and	from	Nooh,	
and	Ibrahim,	and	Moosa,	and	Eisa	the	son	
of	Maryam;	and	We	took	a	firm	covenant	
from	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	aey	Maḥboob	yād	karo	jab	ham	ne	
Nabiyoñ	se	'ahad	liyā	aur	tum	se	aur	Nūḥ	
aur	Ibrāhim	aur	Mūsā	aur	Isā	bin	Maryam	
se	aur	Ham	ne	un	se	gārdhā	'ahad	liyā.

arabicText: لِّيَسْـَٔلَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ عَن صِدْقِهِمْ ۚ وَأَعَدَّ لِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
So	that	He	may	question	the	truthful	
regarding	their	truth;	and	He	has	kept	
prepared	a	painful	punishment	for	the	
disbelievers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tākay	sachchoñ	se	un	ke	sach	kā	suwāl	
kare	aur	us	ne	kāfiroñ	ke	liye	dardnāk	
'aƶāb	tayār	kar	rakhā	hai.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱذْكُرُوا۟ نِعْمَةَ ٱللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ إِذْ جَآءَتْكُمْ جُنُودٌۭ فَأَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِيحًۭا وَجُنُودًۭا لَّمْ تَرَوْهَا ۚ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرًا
englishTranslationText:
O	People	who	believe!	Remember	the	
favour	of	Allah	upon	you	when	some	
armies	came	against	you,	so	We	sent	
against	them	a	windstorm	and	the	armies	
you	could	not	see;	and	Allah	sees	your	
deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Imān	wālo!	Allāh	kā	iḥsān	apne	upar	
yād	karo	jab	tum	par	kuch	lashkar	āaye	to	
ham	ne	un	par	āañdhi	aur	woh	lashkar	
bheje	jo	tumheñ	nazar	na	āaye	aur	Allāh	
tumhāre	kām	dekhtā	hai.

arabicText: إِذْ جَآءُوكُم مِّن فَوْقِكُمْ وَمِنْ أَسْفَلَ مِنكُمْ وَإِذْ زَاغَتِ ٱلْأَبْصَـٰرُ وَبَلَغَتِ ٱلْقُلُوبُ ٱلْحَنَاجِرَ وَتَظُنُّونَ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلظُّنُونَا۠
englishTranslationText:
When	the	disbelievers	came	upon	you	
from	above	you	and	from	below	you,	and	
when	the	eyes	became	fixed	in	stare	and	
the	hearts	came	up	to	the	throats,	and	you	
were	imagining	matters	regarding	Allah.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	kāfir	tum	par	āaye	tumhāre	upar	se	
aur	tumhāre	neeche	se	aur	jab	ke	thitak	
kar	rah	gayiñ	nigāheñ	aur	dil	galoñ	ke	pās	
āa	gaye	aur	tum	Allāh	par	ṭaraḥ	ṭaraḥ	ke	
gumān	karne	lage.

arabicText: هُنَالِكَ ٱبْتُلِىَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ وَزُلْزِلُوا۟ زِلْزَالًۭا شَدِيدًۭا ١١
englishTranslationText:
That	proved	be	the	testing	ground	for	the	
Muslims,	and	they	were	subjected	to	a	
severe	shake.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jagah	thi	ke	Musalmānoñ	ki	jānch	
huyi	aur	khoob	sakhti	se	jhanjhode	gaye.

arabicText: وَإِذْ يَقُولُ ٱلْمُنَـٰفِقُونَ وَٱلَّذِينَ فِى قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌۭ مَّا وَعَدَنَا ٱللَّهُ وَرَسُولُهُۥٓ إِلَّا غُرُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	when	the	hypocrites,	and	those	in	
whose	hearts	is	a	disease,	began	saying,	
“Allah	and	His	Noble	Messenger	have	not	
given	us	a	promise	except	one	of	deceit.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	kahne	lage	munāfiq	aur	jin	ke	
diloñ	meiñ	rog	thā	hameñ	Allāh	wa	Rasool	
ne	w'ada	na	diyā	thā	magar	fareb	kā.

arabicText: وَإِذْ قَالَت طَّآئِفَةٌۭ مِّنْهُمْ يَـٰٓأَهْلَ يَثْرِبَ لَا مُقَامَ لَكُمْ فَٱرْجِعُوا۟ ۚ وَيَسْتَـْٔذِنُ فَرِيقٌۭ مِّنْهُمُ ٱلنَّبِىَّ يَقُولُونَ إِنَّ بُيُوتَنَا عَوْرَةٌۭ وَمَا هِىَ بِعَوْرَةٍ ۖ إِن يُرِيدُونَ إِلَّا فِرَارًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	when	a	group	among	said,	“O	people	of	Medinah!	This	is	no	place	of	stay	for	you,	therefore	
go	back	to	your	homes”;	and	a	group	among	them	sought	exemption	from	the	Prophet	by	
saying,	“Our	homes	are	unprotected”	whereas	their	homes	were	not	unprotected;	they	willed	
nothing	except	to	flee.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	un	meiñ	se	aik	giroh	ne	kahā	aey	
madine	wālo!	Yahāñ	tumhāre	thahrne	ki	
jagah	nahiñ	tum	gharoñ	ko	wāpas	chalo	
aur	un	meiñ	se	aik	giroh	nabi	se	iƶn	māngtā	thā	ye	kah	kar	ke	hamāre	ghar	be-ḥifāzat	haiñ	aur	
woh	be-ḥifāzat	na	the	woh	to	na	chāhte	the	magar	bhāgnā.

arabicText: وَلَوْ دُخِلَتْ عَلَيْهِم مِّنْ أَقْطَارِهَا ثُمَّ سُئِلُوا۟ ٱلْفِتْنَةَ لَـَٔاتَوْهَا وَمَا تَلَبَّثُوا۟ بِهَآ إِلَّا يَسِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	if	the	armies	had	come	upon	them	from	the	outskirts	of	Medinah	and	demanded	disbelief	from	them,	
they	would	certainly	have	given	them	their	demand	and	would	not	have	hesitated	in	it	except	a	little.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	un	par	faujeñ	Madine	ke	aṭrāf	se	āatiñ	phir	un	se	kufr	chāhtiñ	to	zaror	un	kā	māñgā	de	
baith	te	aur	us	meiñ	der	na	karte	magar	thodi.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ كَانُوا۟ عَـٰهَدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مِن قَبْلُ لَا يُوَلُّونَ ٱلْأَدْبَـٰرَ ۚ وَكَانَ عَهْدُ ٱللَّهِ مَسْـُٔولًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	before	this	they	had	agreed	with	Allah	that	they	would	not	turn	their	backs;	and	the	covenant	
of	Allah	will	be	questioned	about.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	is	se	pahle	woh	Allāh	se	'ahad	kar	chuke	the	ke	peeth	na	phereñ	ge	aur	Allāh	kā	
'ahad	pooñchā	jāye	gā.

arabicText: قُل لَّن يَنفَعَكُمُ ٱلْفِرَارُ إِن فَرَرْتُم مِّنَ ٱلْمَوْتِ أَوِ ٱلْقَتْلِ وَإِذًۭا لَّا تُمَتَّعُونَ إِلَّا قَلِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“Fleeing	will	never	benefit	you	if	
you	flee	from	death	or	killing,	and	even	
then	you	will	not	be	given	the	usage	of	
this	world	except	a	little.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	hargiz	tumheiñ	bhāgnā	nafá	
na	degā	agar	Maut	yā	qatl	se	bhāgo	aur	
jab	bhi	dunyā	na	bartne	diye	jāo	ge	magar	
thodi.

arabicText: قُلْ مَن ذَا ٱلَّذِى يَعْصِمُكُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ إِنْ أَرَادَ بِكُمْ سُوٓءًا أَوْ أَرَادَ بِكُمْ رَحْمَةًۭ ۚ وَلَا يَجِدُونَ لَهُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَلِيًّۭا وَلَا نَصِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Say,	“Who	is	he	who	can	avert	the	
command	of	Allah	from	you,	if	He	wills	
harm	for	you	or	wills	to	have	mercy	upon	
you?”	And	other	than	Allah,	they	will	not	
find	any	friend	or	supporter.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	woh	kaun	hai	jo	Allāh	kā	
ḥukm	tum	par	se	tāl	de	agar	woh	tumhārā	
burā	chāhe	yā	tum	par	mehar	(Raḥam)	
farmānā	chāhe	aur	woh	Allāh	ke	siwā	koi	
ḥāmi	na	pāyeñ	ge	na	madadgār.

arabicText: ۞ قَدْ يَعْلَمُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْمُعَوِّقِينَ مِنكُمْ وَٱلْقَآئِلِينَ لِإِخْوَٰنِهِمْ هَلُمَّ إِلَيْنَا ۖ وَلَا يَأْتُونَ ٱلْبَأْسَ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	Allah	knows	those	among	you	who	
prevent	others	from	the	holy	war,	and	
those	who	say	to	their	brothers,	“Come	
towards	us”;	and	they	do	not	come	to	
fight,	except	a	few.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Allāh	jāntā	hai	tumhāre	un	ko	jo	
auroñ	ko	Jihad	se	rokte	haiñ	aur	apne	
bhāiyoñ	se	kahte	haiñ	hamāri	ṭaraf	chale	
āao	aur	ladāyi	meiñ	nahiñ	āate	magar	
thode.

arabicText: أَشِحَّةً عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ فَإِذَا جَآءَ ٱلْخَوْفُ رَأَيْتَهُمْ يَنظُرُونَ إِلَيْكَ تَدُورُ أَعْيُنُهُمْ كَٱلَّذِى يُغْشَىٰ عَلَيْهِ مِنَ ٱلْمَوْتِ ۖ فَإِذَا ذَهَبَ ٱلْخَوْفُ سَلَقُوكُم بِأَلْسِنَةٍ حِدَادٍ أَشِحَّةً عَلَى ٱلْخَيْرِ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَمْ يُؤْمِنُوا۟ فَأَحْبَطَ ٱللَّهُ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ ۚ وَكَانَ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ يَسِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
They	reduce	the	help	towards	you;	so	
when	a	fearful	time	comes,	you	will	
observe	them	looking	at	you	with	eyes	
rolling	like	one	enveloped	by	death;	then	
when	the	time	of	fear	is	over,	they	begin	
slandering	you	with	sharp	tongues	in	
their	greed	for	the	war	booty;	they	have	
not	accepted	faith,	therefore	Allah	has	
nullified	their	deeds;	and	this	is	easy	for	
Allah.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tumhāri	madad	meiñ	gayi	(kotāhi)	karte	
haiñ	phir	jab	dar	ka	waqt	āaye	tum	unheñ	
dekho	ge	tumhāri	ṭaraf	yuñ	nazar	karte	
haiñ	ke	un	ki	āañkheñ	ghoom	rahi	haiñ	
jaise	kisi	par	Maut	chhāyi	ho	phir	jab	dar	
ka	waqt	nikal	jāye	tumheñ	ṭ'ane	dene	
lageñ	tez	zabānoñ	se	māl-e-ghanimat	ke	
lālach	meiñ	ye	log	Imān	lāye	hi	nahiñ	to	
Allāh	ne	in	ke	'amal	akārat	kar	diye	aur	ye	
Allāh	ko	āasān	hai.

arabicText: يَحْسَبُونَ ٱلْأَحْزَابَ لَمْ يَذْهَبُوا۟ ۖ وَإِن يَأْتِ ٱلْأَحْزَابُ يَوَدُّوا۟ لَوْ أَنَّهُم بَادُونَ فِى ٱلْأَعْرَابِ يَسْـَٔلُونَ عَنْ أَنۢبَآئِكُمْ ۖ وَلَوْ كَانُوا۟ فِيكُم مَّا قَـٰتَلُوٓا۟ إِلَّا قَلِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
They	assume	that	the	armies	of	the	
disbelievers	have	not	gone	away;	and	
were	the	armies	to	come	again,	their	wish	
would	be	to	go	out	to	the	villages	seeking	
information	about	you;	and	were	they	to	
stay	among	you	even	then	they	would	not	fight,	except	a	few.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	samjh	rahe	haiñ	ke	kāfiroñ	ke	
lashkar	abhi	na	gaye	aur	agar	lashkar	dobāra	āayeñ	to	un	ki	khwāhish	hogi	ke	kisi	ṭaraḥ	gāoñ	
meiñ	nikal	kar	tumhāri	khabreñ	pooñchte	aur	agar	woh	tum	meiñ	rahte	jab	bhi	na	ladte	magar	
thode.

arabicText: لَّقَدْ كَانَ لَكُمْ فِى رَسُولِ ٱللَّهِ أُسْوَةٌ حَسَنَةٌۭ لِّمَن كَانَ يَرْجُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱلْيَوْمَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَ وَذَكَرَ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	following	the	Noble	Messenger	of	Allah	is	better	for	you	–	for	one	who	is	confident	of	
Allah	and	the	Last	Day,	and	remembers	Allah	much.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	tumheñ	Rasool-ul-Allāh	ki	pairwi	behtar	hai	us	ke	liye	ke	Allāh	aur	pichle	din	ki	
ummeed	rakhtā	ho	aur	Allāh	ko	bahut	yād	kare.

arabicText: وَلَمَّا رَءَا ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ ٱلْأَحْزَابَ قَالُوا۟ هَـٰذَا مَا وَعَدَنَا ٱللَّهُ وَرَسُولُهُۥ وَصَدَقَ ٱللَّهُ وَرَسُولُهُۥ ۚ وَمَا زَادَهُمْ إِلَّآ إِيمَـٰنًۭا وَتَسْلِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	when	the	Muslims	saw	the	armies,	they	said,	“This	is	what	Allah	and	His	Noble	Messenger	
promised	us,	and	Allah	and	His	Noble	Messenger	have	spoken	the	truth”;	and	it	did	not	increase	
anything	for	them	but	faith	and	acceptance	of	Allah’s	will.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	Musalmānoñ	ne	kāfiroñ	ke	lashkar	dekhe	bole	ye	hai	woh	jo	hameñ	w'ada	diyā	thā	Allāh	
aur	us	ke	Rasool	ne	aur	sach	farmāyā	Allāh	aur	us	ke	Rasool	ne	aur	is	se	unheñ	na	badhā	magar	
Imān	aur	Allāh	ki	razā	par	rāzi	honā.

arabicText: مِّنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ رِجَالٌۭ صَدَقُوا۟ مَا عَـٰهَدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ عَلَيْهِ ۖ فَمِنْهُم مَّن قَضَىٰ نَحْبَهُۥ وَمِنْهُم مَّن يَنتَظِرُ ۖ وَمَا بَدَّلُوا۟ تَبْدِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Among	the	Muslims	are	the	men	who	
have	proved	true	what	they	had	
covenanted	with	Allah;	so	among	them	is	
one	who	has	already	fulfilled	his	vow,	and	
among	them	is	one	still	waiting;	and	they	
have	not	changed	a	bit.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Musalmānoñ	meiñ	kuch	woh	mard	haiñ	
jinhoñ	ne	sachchā	kar	diyā	jo	áhad	Allāh	
se	kiyā	thā	to	un	meiñ	koi	apni	mannat	
pori	kar	chuka	aur	koi	rāh	dekh	rahā	hai	
aur	woh	ƶarā	na	badle.

arabicText: لِّيَجْزِىَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ بِصِدْقِهِمْ وَيُعَذِّبَ ٱلْمُنَـٰفِقِينَ إِن شَآءَ أَوْ يَتُوبَ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ غَفُورًۭا رَّحِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
In	order	that	Allah	may	reward	the	
truthful	for	their	truthfulness,	and	punish	
the	hypocrites	if	He	wills,	or	give	them	
repentance;	indeed	Allah	is	Oft	Forgiving,	
Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tākay	Allāh	sachchoñ	ko	un	ke	sach	kā	
sila	de	aur	munāfiqoñ	ko	'aƶāb	kare	agar	
chāhe	yā	unheñ	taubā	de	be-shak	Allāh	
bakhshne	wālā	maherbān	hai.

arabicText: وَرَدَّ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِغَيْظِهِمْ لَمْ يَنَالُوا۟ خَيْرًۭا ۚ وَكَفَى ٱللَّهُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ٱلْقِتَالَ ۚ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ قَوِيًّا عَزِيزًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	Allah	turned	back	the	disbelievers	in	
their	hearts’	jealousy,	gaining	no	good;	
and	Allah	sufficed	the	Muslims	in	their	
fight;	and	Allah	is	Almighty,	Most	
Honourable.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	ne	kāfiroñ	ko	un	ke	diloñ	ki	
jalan	ke	sāth	paltāyā	ke	kuch	bhalā	na	
pāyā	aur	Allāh	ne	Musalmānoñ	ko	ladāyi	
ki	kifāyat	di	aur	Allāh	zabardast	'izzat	
wālā	hai.

arabicText: وَأَنزَلَ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَـٰهَرُوهُم مِّنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ مِن صَيَاصِيهِمْ وَقَذَفَ فِى قُلُوبِهِمُ ٱلرُّعْبَ فَرِيقًۭا تَقْتُلُونَ وَتَأْسِرُونَ فَرِيقًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	He	brought	down	from	their	forts,	the	
People	given	the	Book(s)	who	had	
supported	them,	and	instilled	awe	into	
their	hearts	-	you	slay	a	group	among	
them	and	another	group	you	make	
captive.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jin	Ahl-e-Kitāb	ne	un	ki	madad	ki	thi	
unheñ	un	ke	qil'aoñ	se	utārā	aur	un	ke	
diloñ	meiñ	ro'b	dālā	un	meiñ	aik	giroh	ko	
tum	qatl	karte	ho	aur	aik	giroh	ko	qaid.

arabicText: وَأَوْرَثَكُمْ أَرْضَهُمْ وَدِيَـٰرَهُمْ وَأَمْوَٰلَهُمْ وَأَرْضًۭا لَّمْ تَطَـُٔوهَا ۚ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ قَدِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	He	bequeathed	you	their	lands	and	
their	houses	and	their	wealth,	and	land	
that	you	have	not	yet	set	foot	upon;	and	
Allah	is	Able	to	do	all	things.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	ne	tumhāre	hath	lagāye	un	ki	
zameen	aur	un	ke	makān	aur	un	ke	māl	
aur	woh	zameen	jis	par	tum	ne	abhi	
qadam	nahiñ	rakhā	hai	aur	Allāh	har	chiz	
par	qādir	hai.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ قُل لِّأَزْوَٰجِكَ إِن كُنتُنَّ تُرِدْنَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَزِينَتَهَا فَتَعَالَيْنَ أُمَتِّعْكُنَّ وَأُسَرِّحْكُنَّ سَرَاحًۭا جَمِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
O	Herald	of	the	Hidden!	Say	to	your	wives,	
“If	you	desire	the	worldly	life	and	its	adornment	–	therefore	come,	I	shall	give	you	wealth	and	a	
befitting	release!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Ghaib	batāne	wāle	(Nabi)	apni	bibiyoñ	se	farmā	de	agar	tum	duniyā	ki	zindagi	aur	us	ki	
āarāish	chāhti	ho	to	āao	meiñ	tumheñ	māl	du’ñ	aur	achchi	ṭaraḥ	chord	du’ñ.

arabicText: وَإِن كُنتُنَّ تُرِدْنَ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ وَٱلدَّارَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةَ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ أَعَدَّ لِلْمُحْسِنَـٰتِ مِنكُنَّ أَجْرًا عَظِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“And	if	you	desire	Allah	and	His	Noble	Messenger	and	the	abode	of	the	Hereafter	-	then	indeed	
Allah	has	kept	prepared	an	immense	reward	for	the	virtuous	among	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	tum	Allāh	aur	us	ke	Rasool	aur	Āakhirat	kā	ghar	chāhti	ho	to	be-shak	Allāh	ne	tumhāri	
neki	wāliyoñ	ke	liye	badā	Ajr	tayyār	kar	rakhā	hai.

arabicText: يَـٰنِسَآءَ ٱلنَّبِىِّ مَن يَأْتِ مِنكُنَّ بِفَـٰحِشَةٍۢ مُّبَيِّنَةٍۢ يُضَـٰعَفْ لَهَا ٱلْعَذَابُ ضِعْفَيْنِ ۚ وَكَانَ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ يَسِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
O	the	wives	of	the	Prophet!	If	any	among	you	dares	to	commit	an	act	contrary	to	decency,	for	
her	will	be	double	the	punishment	of	others;	and	this	is	easy	for	Allah.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Nabi	ki	bibiyoñ	jo	tum	meiñ	sariḥ	Hayā	ke	khilāf	koi	jur’at	kare	us	par	auroñ	se	donā	
(dugnā)	ázāb	hogā	aur	ye	Allāh	ko	āasān	hai.
